Entries.default: A long rope is suspended over the span between two docks. Their oft-used look means they're likely intended to help move cargo off ships.
[Use the ropes to shimmy across the water to the opposite dock.]
The ropes haven't been cinched tight in some time and hang a bit loose on their pulleys. Their lack of tension will demand a fair bit of strength and flexibility to cross safely.
You begin the awkward hand-over-hand climb across the gap.
You and your companions begin the awkward hand-over-hand climb across the gap.
You manage to pull yourself across the gap, but only with significant effort.
You to reach the opposite dock without incident.
Not everyone in your party is up to the task. You all manage the crossing, but suffer exertion in the process.
Everyone reaches the opposite dock without incident.
